title: Gaza death toll since dawn rises to 23
summary:
Gaza death toll since dawn rises to 23

Israeli forces have killed at least 23 Palestinians in Gaza since dawn on Monday, including 21 killings in Gaza City, Al Jazeera has reported quoting medical sources. 

The Palestinian health ministry said on Sunday that Israel has killed over 66,000 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip. 

The ministry noted that the death toll had climbed to 66,005, with a further 168,162 wounded since 7 October 2023.

title: Houthis claim firing 'Palestine 2 hypersonic missile' on Israel
summary:
Houthis claim firing 'Palestine 2 hypersonic missile' on Israel

Yemenâ€™s Houthi group on Monday claimed responsibility for launching a hypersonic ballistic missile at targets in Israel.

Palestine 2 hypersonic ballistic missile with multiple warheads was fired at the Tel Aviv area, Houthis said in a statement. 

The group said the strikes were carried out in response to the "crimes of genocide and the dangerous escalation carried out by the Israeli enemy against our people in the Gaza Stripâ€, the Houthis said, adding they would â€œcontinue to fulfil our religious, moral, and humanitarian duties until the aggression against Gaza stopsâ€.

The Israeli military said that it intercepted a missile launched from Yemen, and that sirens were sounded across central Israel. 

"Following the sirens that sounded a short while ago in several areas of Israel, a missile launched from Yemen was intercepted," it said in a statement on Telegram. 

On 24 September, at least 20 people were wounded after a drone crashed and exploded in the southern Israeli port city of Eilat.

The following day, officials of the Houthi movement Ansar Allah, said that eight people had been killed and 142 others wounded in an attack by Israel on Yemen's capital Sanaa.

Israeli forces deployed 20 fighter jets to attack 60 targets, targeting Houthi military leaders, command headquarters and weapons depots, Israel's Channel 14 reported.

title: Israeli forces kill 17 Palestinians since dawn on Monday
summary:
Israeli forces kill 17 Palestinians since dawn on Monday

Israeli forces killed at least 17 Palestinians in Gaza since dawn on Monday, Al Jazeera Arabic reported, quoting hospital sources. The number includes at least 16 Palestinians in Gaza City.

The Palestinian health ministry said on Sunday that Israel has killed over 66,000 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip. 

The ministry noted that the death toll had climbed to 66,005, with a further 168,162 wounded since 7 October 2023.

title: Missile launched from Yemen intercepted, Israeli army says
summary:
Missile launched from Yemen intercepted, Israeli army says

The Israeli military on Monday said that it intercepted a missile launched from Yemen, and that sirens were sounded across central Israel. 

"Following the sirens that sounded a short while ago in several areas of Israel, a missile launched from Yemen was intercepted," it said in a statement on Telegram. 

On 24 September, at least 20 people were wounded after a drone crashed and exploded in the southern Israeli port city of Eilat.

The following day, officials of the Houthi movement Ansar Allah said that eight people had been killed and 142 others wounded in an attack by Israel on Yemen's capital Sanaa.

Israeli forces deployed 20 fighter jets to attack 60 targets, targeting Houthi military leaders, command headquarters and weapons depots, Israel's Channel 14 reported.

title: Israeli military announces killing of Hamas's commander
summary:
Israeli military announces killing of Hamas's commander

The Israeli military on Sunday said that it had killed Hamas's commander Hasan Mahmoud Hasan Hussein, who was part of the 7 October 2023 attack. 

Hussein was a commander of the Nukhba company in Hamasâ€™s Bureij Battalion, Israeli media have reported. 

Hussein led the attack on the bomb shelter on Route 232 in Kibbutz Reâ€™im, according to the military.

title: Israel destroyed Christian presence in Palestine, Church affairs committee says
summary:
Israel destroyed Christian presence in Palestine, Church affairs committee says

Higher Presidential Committee for Church Affairs (HPCCA) in Palestine on Sunday said that Israel has destroyed the Christian presence in Palestine and continues to bomb churches in Gaza. 

The Palestinian governmental body posted a statement on the US social media company Facebook, accompanied by a photo of an Israeli tank outside the Church of the Nativity during the 2002 West Bank incursion.

â€œIn a nearly empty UN General Assembly hall, war criminal and ICC fugitive Benjamin Netanyahu once again spread lies about Palestinian Christians,â€ the committee said, in response to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahuâ€™s speech Friday at the UN General Assembly, in which he claimed Israel is the only state in the Middle East that protects Christians.

â€œThe truth is clear: Israelâ€™s colonial policies of ethnic cleansing, apartheid and genocide have destroyed the Christian presence in Palestine,â€ HPCCA said.

"Before the 1948 Nakba, Palestinian Christians constituted 12.5% of the historical population of Palestine. Today, there is only 1.2% left in historic Palestine, and only 1% in the occupied Palestinian territories in 1967," the committee said.

title: Iran executes man accused of spying for Israel
summary:
Iran executes man accused of spying for Israel

Iran executed a man accused of spying for Israel on Monday, the judiciary's news outlet Mizan said, naming the defendant "Bahman Choubi-asl".

Iran has called the man 'one of the most important spies' for Israel, Reuters news agency reported. 

The development comes a day after widespread United Nations sanctions, including an arms embargo, against Iran were reinstated, marking the first time in a decade that the full range of measures has been reimposed.

The move follows the collapse of nuclear negotiations between Iran and western powers, reigniting tensions surrounding Tehran's nuclear programme.

The sanctions, target Iran's nuclear and ballistic missile activities. They are also expected to worsen the country's already fragile economy, just three months after Israeli and US attacks on its nuclear facilities.

Tehran has warned of a harsh response to the reimposition of sanctions and called on countries not to enforce them.

"The reactivation of annulled resolutions is not only legally baseless and unjustifiable... all countries must refrain from recognising this illegal situation," the Iranian foreign ministry said in a statement.

title: Labour conference to vote on Israel sanctions and recognising Gaza genocide
summary:
Labour conference to vote on Israel sanctions and recognising Gaza genocide

Labour party delegates will vote on an emergency motion declaring that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza and demanding a full arms embargo on Monday at the annual conference in Liverpool.

Middle East Minister Hamish Falconer argued against the motion earlier on Sunday, saying it could threaten elements of the peace process in the Middle East.

The motion, "Peace in the Middle East 2", comes alongside another motion understood to broadly support Labour policy on Israel.

The governing partyâ€™s annual conference began in Liverpool on Sunday, just a week after the government recognised the state of Palestine in a historic move.

If the new motion passes, the Labour conference will officially accept the findings of a recent UN Commission of Inquiry report, which found that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, and will back comprehensive sanctions on Israel and a full arms embargo.

Read more: Labour conference to vote on Israel sanctions and recognising Gaza genocide

title: Hamas's approval necessary for Gaza agreement, says White House
summary:
Hamas's approval necessary for Gaza agreement, says White House

White House officials on Monday said that Hamas's approval is necessary to reach an agreement in Gaza, American news organisation Axios has reported. 

The officials said that such a step had not yet been formalised, adding that they were "very close" to reaching an agreement on Trump's plan. 

US President Donald Trump's proposal to end the war in Gaza includes the destruction of all offensive weapons belonging to the Islamic Resistance Movement (Hamas) and for amnesty for fighters who commit to peaceful coexistence. 

According to the 21-point plan, safe passage to other countries would be facilitated for Hamas members who choose to leave, the report mentions. 

The proposal also includes an immediate cessation of all military operations, a freeze of fighting lines in place, and the release of all prisoners within 48 hours.

Hamas on Thursday had said that its "weapons cannot be touched" and that resistance was a national and moral responsibility that derives its legitimacy from the Palestinian people.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • The Palestinian Health Ministry on Sunday said that Israel has killed over 66,000 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip. 

  • The ministry noted that the death toll had climbed to 66,005, with a further 168,162 wounded since 7 October. 

  • Among the death were 79 who were brought to hospitals in the past 24 hours.

  • The Israeli army has demolished a multistorey building in Gaza City, just under an hour after ordering residents in several neighbourhoods to evacuate.

  • The head of Unrwa says Gazaâ€™s schools have been â€œcompletely destroyedâ€ by Israelâ€™s assault, forcing families to live in ruins and struggle each day for food and water.

  • Nissim Vaturi, Likud parliamentarian and deputy Knesset speaker, said in a Knesset Channel interview that â€œthe Israeli interest is that there wouldnâ€™t be any Arabs here,â€ referring to the occupied West Bank. â€œIf we could expel everyone, we would have done it,â€ he added.

  • Lebanonâ€™s National News Agency says Israeli jets carried out several raids this afternoon on areas between Medena Plain, Kfarreman and Jarmaq.

  • Police in Liverpool have arrested dozens of demonstrators outside the Labour Party conference after activists staged a sit-in against the governmentâ€™s ban on Palestine Action.

title: Dozens arrested at Labour conference protest over Palestine Action ban
summary:
Dozens arrested at Labour conference protest over Palestine Action ban

Police in Liverpool have arrested dozens of demonstrators outside the Labour Party conference after activists staged a sit-in against the governmentâ€™s ban on Palestine Action.

Around 100 people gathered on Sunday holding placards declaring: â€œI oppose genocide. I support Palestine Action.â€

The British government outlawed the group in April, designating it a terrorist organisation just weeks after campaigners sprayed red paint over an RAF aircraft allegedly carrying weapons parts destined for Israel.

Palestine Action has long targeted arms factories and government buildings, accusing the UK of enabling Israelâ€™s war on Gaza.

The ban is highly unusual for a homegrown protest network and means that even voicing support could result in a prison sentence of up to 14 years.

Civil liberties advocates, the United Nations and Amnesty International have all denounced the decision, while critics across the political spectrum say it amounts to a sweeping assault on free speech.

title: Patients forced to flee al-Shifa hospital as Israeli army attacks hospital
summary:
Patients forced to flee al-Shifa hospital as Israeli army attacks hospital

Doctors inside Gazaâ€™s al-Shifa Hospital say they are witnessing â€œhorrific scenesâ€ as patients are forced to flee even while in urgent need of treatment.

Testimonies collected by the Palestinian Centre for Human Rights accuse Israeli forces of using fire belts â€“ incendiary weapons that unleash walls of flame â€“ and sending explosives-packed vehicles around the hospital while advancing from its northern and eastern sides.

Medical workers report that the shelling has paralysed many operations, with doctors unable to reach the hospital and some already killed in the strikes.

Dr Hasan al-Shaâ€™ir, al-Shifaâ€™s medical director, told researchers that staff continued to work â€œdespite the harsh conditions and overwhelming fearâ€, recalling earlier sieges in which Israeli forces killed and detained medical teams.

He said around 100 patients remain inside, struggling to survive in â€œextremely difficult circumstancesâ€, with life-saving drugs and equipment running dangerously low.

title: A modern museum in Tehran narrates the story of Islamic Revolution and Iraqi invasion of Iran
summary: Nestled in Tehran, the National Museum of the Islamic Revolution and Holy Defence presents itself as the largest and most modern war museum of the Muslim world, offering a technology-driven journey through Iranâ€™s revolutionary and war history.

title: US, European attempts to restore UNSC resolutions against Iran â€˜illegalâ€™: Baghaei
summary: Iranâ€™s Foreign Ministry spokesperson says the abuse of the JCPOA dispute resolution process by three European countries should have no effect on the fact that â€œResolution 2231 based on its text must expire on its due date.â€

title: Araghchi: No valid legal action has been taken to revive expired resolutions
summary: In a letter to his counterparts in other countries, the Foreign Minister of the Islamic Republic of Iran said that no valid legal action has been taken to revive the expired resolutions, and the efforts of the aforementioned countries are in fact a unilateral rewriting of international law and an abuse of the United Nations."

title: President Pezeshkian urges Americans to reject support for Israeli regime
summary: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian dismissed the US foreign policy in the Middle East, particularly its support for the apartheid and genocidal Israeli regime.

title: Hamas says West Bank attack response to Gaza genocide
summary: Hamas urged Palestinians to unite their ranks, coordinate efforts and â€œignite the confrontation arenaâ€ against Israeli forces and settlers.

title: Pezeshkian: Iran pursues path of steadfastness and dignity against bullies
summary: President Pezeshkian said that Iran will consistently follow a path of dignity and self-reliance, asserting that the Iranians will never surrender to foreign bullies.

title: President Pezeshkian returns from New York
summary: President Masoud Pezeshkian arrives in Tehran on September 28, 2025, after delivering a speech at the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly in New York.

title: Sacred Defense Week in Iran
summary: Every year, Iranians commemorate the memory of martyrs and veterans who defended the country during the Iraqi-imposed war in the 1980s. Different events are organized from September 22 to 28 dubbed â€˜Sacred Defense Weekâ€™ across the country to remember a large-scale war that was launched by Iraqâ€™s Baâ€™athist regime.

title: Former human rights official warns scientist assassinations threaten humanity
summary: The former secretary of High Council for Human rights of the Judiciary of Islamic Republic of Iran said the United States and the West are trying to make knowledge exclusive and deprive others of it, but this is completely against the essence of science.

title: Larijani: Iran stands by Lebanon and Resistance
summary: Top security official, Ali Larijani, met with Hezbollah Secretary-General Sheikh Naim Qassem, where he reaffirmed Iranâ€™s unwavering support for Lebanon and the Resistance.

title: Iran does not need permission from anyone to boost defensive capabilities: Senior commander
summary: Brigadier General Abolfazl Shekarchi said that Iranâ€™s enemies, despite possessing nuclear weapons and missiles carrying nuclear warheads, ignore the inalienable right of the Iranian nation to have peaceful nuclear energy.

title: In photos: Iranâ€™s Armenian Christians honor St. George in Tehran
summary: The commemoration of St. George was held at St. George Church, located on Vahdat-e Eslami Street in Tehran, on September 26-27, 2025.

title: Review | Crossing â€” Levan Akin takes the queer road movie beyond expectations
summary: Levan Akinâ€™s road movie about an odyssey from Georgia to Turkey is notably more authentic than his internationally acclaimed And Then We Danced.

title: Abzas Media journalists transferred over 250 kilometres from Baku
summary: The three women journalists â€” Sevinj Abbasova, Elnara Gasimova, and Nargiz Absalamova â€” were not notified of the transfer beforehand.

title: Azerbaijani petrol tycoon arrested for â€˜contaminatingâ€™ crude from different sources
summary: Adnan Ahmadzada, a former SOCAR employee, has been remanded to four months of pre-trial detention.

title: Georgian activist sentenced to 20 days in prison
summary: Isako Devidze was first detained at a protest in Tbilisi marking the 300th day of the daily anti-government protest.

title: Russian Parliament approves the renaming of three Cossack villages in Chechnya
summary: The three villages will be given Chechen names instead.

title: Abkhazianâ€“Korean cultural centre opens in Seoul
summary: The opening ceremony earlier in September was attended by Abkhazian Culture Minister Daur Kove.
